article.title: Competition and Social Control in Science: An Essay in Theory-Construction
article.author: Collins, Randall
article.text: Social control in science operates through the process in which the colleague group validates individual scientists' contributions to knowledge to the laymen who provide support and rewards for science.. Descriptive research in various areas of the sociology of science may be brought together into a causal model which relates competitive conditions within colleague groups to variations in scientific productivity, methods, values, and organizational structures..
